AI Description: PHYLIP (the PHYLogeny Inference Package) is a free package of programs for inferring phylogenies. It is distributed as source code that can be compiled on a wide range of UNIX platforms, as well as on PCs running MS-DOS or MS-Windows.
Core Features: Includes a wide array of tools for phylogenetic analysis such as likelihood-based methods, distance matrix methods, parsimony methods, and tree plotting. Features interactive and batch modes, as well as flexible input/output formats. Capable of handling large datasets and provides statistical support for phylogenetic analysis.
